ou3

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • ou3.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    The class responisble for keeping the network of Node and control their behaviour. Generates this network, the queryNodes and every Node s neighbour. Also controls the Message s during each timeStep.
    See Also:
    network, queryNodes, messages, queuedMessages, Network(String fileName), generateNodes(), assignQueryNodes(), makeNeighbours(), #timeStep(), Node, Message, ArrayList, Random, Collection

      • arrayContains

        private <T> boolean arrayContains(T[] arr,
                        T val)
        Check whether an array of type T contains the value val. Return true if so, and false otherwise.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:

        val - the T value to look for
        Returns:
        boolean over whether arr contains val

      • makeNeighbours

        private void makeNeighbours()
        Generate the arrays of neighbours for every Node in the network.

        Only nodes one rank away ( within 15 units if there's 10 units between every row and column ) will be considered neighbours of the Node.

        See Also:
        network, Node, Node.updateNeighbours(Node[] neighbours )

      • timeStep

        public void timeStep(int time)
        Take timeStep time, updating the network.

        Start by generating Events and AgentMessages. Then generate QueryMessages at the QueryNodes if it's time for that, determined in the Configuration. Then update Messages. And finaly activate all Node s for the next step.

        Parameters:
        time - the current timeStep
        See Also:
        network, queryNodes, messages, queuedMessages, Node, Node#generateEvent(int time ), Node#generateQuery(EventID target ), Message, Message.processMessage(), Message.stepUpdate(), Message.sendMessage()

      • activateNodes

        private void activateNodes()
        Activate nodes after a timeStep so that they are ready next round.

      • handleMessages

        private void handleMessages()
        Handle messages. The Message update will follow the formula:

        For each active Message in messages: process, stepUpdate, and send. if it didn't survive the stepUpdate, mark for removal. if it couldn't send, mark for queueing.

        For each Message in queue queuedMessages: stepUpdate and then attempt send. if it didn't survive the stepUpdate, mark for removal. if it did send, mark as active.

        For each Message marked for removal; drop reference. For each Message to change state, add to correct list and remove from other.

        See Also:
        messages, queuedMessages

      • generateQueries

        private void generateQueries(int time)
        Generate queries. If the time is correct (, once every 400 steps) this will generate new QueryMessage s, from every Node in queryNodes to different targets among all the Event s currently available.
        Parameters:
        time - the current time
        See Also:
        queryNodes

      • generateEvents

        private void generateEvents(int time)
        Generate events. For every Node, test whether it will generate an Event. This follows a set probability. If one is generated, test whether an agent should be spawned aswell.
        Parameters:
        time - the time

      • printMessage

        public void printMessage(java.util.Collection<Message> com)
        Prints the Message s in a collection. Used for testing.
        Parameters:
        com - the Collection of Message

        Returns:

      • printQueryNodes

        public java.lang.String printQueryNodes()
        Prints the query nodes. To see how their position affects the success-rate of queries. Used for testing.
        Returns:
        the nodes as a String
